718610f-a.text:
Chambers Street, north side, east from but not including Church
Street.
March 26, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
718610f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

718612f-a.text:
Chambers Street, west from a point midway between Church Street and West Broadway (Ninth Avenue "El" thereupon) and across the latter to West Street. Buildings on the right are on the north side of this thoroughfare, at the N.E. and N.W. corners of which at West Broadway,are the Cosmopolitan Hotel and the 10 story Irving Building. Opposite the latter at the left is the 14 story Gerken Building, occupying a site at the S.W.corner. Note the cobblestone pavement and the surface car track. Exclusive of the absence of same, this thoroughfare is identical in 1939.
April 1, 1928
P. L. Sperr
718612f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

733476f-a.title: Transportation - Subway construction.
733476f-a.text:
Subway Construction -- Church and Chambers Street
1-24-1928

718611f-a.text:
Chambers Street (left), east from and across Church Street to show office buildings at the S.W. and N.W. corners of Broadway obscuring a view of the Municipal Building. These structures are respectively the Broadway Chambers and the new No. 270 Broadway Building. To the right appears the Pulitzer "World" dome. The photographer's vantage point is No. 90 West Broadway.
February 11, 1931.
P.L. Sperr
718611f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

718876f-a.text:
(1)
Church Street, east side, north from and including Chambers
Street.
March 20, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
The two buildings, No. 99 Chambers and No. 83 Reade Streets, whose sides form the east side of Church Street, from Chambers to Reade will be demolished (September 1937).
(2)
Church Street,East side at Chambers Street looking south on Church Street and showing the Marine Midland Trust Company
building.
P.L.Sperr,  May 4th,1941.
No Reproductions.
718876f-a.folder: Church Street & Chambers Street, Manhattan, NY
